paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

functional_data.summary: The TTR gene mutations are associated with a range of phenotypes, primarily cardiac.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, mutations segregate with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The most frequent mutation was Val30Met, with 1038 subjects (73.6%) affected.
key_quotes: There were 54 different TTR mutations represented in the population; 16 of these were shared by ≥5 subjects.
In subjects with ATTRm in European countries in the THAOS registry, Val30Met was the most frequent mutation (1038 subjects, 73.6%).

functional_data.summary: ATTRwt is associated with a mainly cardiac phenotype.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, ATTRwt is associated with disease.
variants.additional_notes: ATTRwt was observed in all countries except Portugal, Belgium, and Cyprus.
key_quotes: Subjects with cardiac mutations or ATTRwt (or cardiac or mixed phenotype) had a lower survival rate than subjects in other genotype categories.

functional_data.summary: Associated with a mainly cardiac phenotype showing symmetric left ventricular hypertrophy.

variants.additional_notes: This mutation is one of the cardiac mutations associated with ATTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: Four mutations (Val122Ile, Leu111Met, Thr60Ala, and Ile68Leu) were associated with a mainly cardiac phenotype.

key_quotes: Four mutations (Val122Ile, Leu111Met, Thr60Ala, and Ile68Leu) were associated with a mainly cardiac phenotype.
